text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pickled grilled pickles and
don't call these grilled pickles because
they're not pickles that are grilled
they're pickles that we grill first and
then pickle
all right I'm confused too by the way we
learn this from Chris Lilly at Kingsford
University very cool trick so here we go
this is going to work with any number of
vegetables I'm going to use some of
these pickling cucumbers all right also
sold as many cucumbers I've actually
seen these called Persian cucumbers
before but those might be actually a
different variety so I'm just going to
simply cut those in half lengthwise and
I'm also going to cut some strips of red
bell pepper alright so those are ready
for the grill we're not going to season
them we're not going to oil them we're
not going to salt them nothing okay
we're going to head outside to our grill
which is already very hot we're using a
charcoal fire not a gas grill we're not
really cooking these all right we're
just giving them some grill marks for
appearance and more importantly a little
bit of that smoky char grill flavor
that's the secret basically to this
technique so I only gave those about two
minutes per side again not trying to
cook them through just trying to give
them a nice grill mark just soften them
ever so slightly and that's really it
okay so just a couple minutes per side I
did the same thing with my red pepper
all right those are still crisp just got
the char marks on them so our vegetables
are grilled we're going back inside I'm
going to take two mason jars all right I
believe those are 16 ounce jars but this
really is going to work with anything
you could fill all right I'm kind of
arranging it so the cut sides are out so
I can see those beautiful grill marks
and then I'm going to pack the red
peppers in and around to fill those up
once our jars are filled it's on to the
brine or the pickling liquid so basic
water vinegar and sugar in equal parts
some red pepper flakes some dried dill
some black peppercorns some kosher salt
of course all the amounts are going to
be on the site all right you knew that
right I'm going to bring that over to
the stove I'm going to put it on medium
I'm gonna throw in a couple peeled
cloves of garlic of course one separate
so it looks like three later here but
don't worry so there's really no recipe
to this other than the basic sugar salt
vinegar water sort of base so I kept
this very simple since this is the first
time I've ever pickled grilled pickles I
wanted to sort of mostly taste that so I
kept my brine I kept my liquid here very
very basic as soon as that all dissolves
the sugar the salt everything is
dissolved and the mixture begins to
simmer we are good to go
I'm going to fill those up carefully
with my liquid all the way to the top
all right I'm using sterilized jars
which just means they were sort of
dipped in boiling water for a few
minutes
I'm not going to can these or boil them
in a canner and do the vacuum seal just
not necessary these are only going to
stay in my fridge maybe a week at the
most
nothing is really going to grow in that
brine too much salt and acid in there
for much bad to happen okay but you
could can these of course okay once
those are filled I'm going to give it
the old tap a tappa there might be some
air bubbles and you want those that come
up to the surface
I'm going to screw the lids on I'm going
to leave these out for about an hour to
cool down to room temperature then we're
going to put them in the fridge for at
least 24 hours and then oh yeah you know
it's next we're going to taste these now
I wanted to try these after a day just
to see you know how good they were but
I'm also going to try these again in you
know two or three days to see how they
hold up so let me try one of these
pickles looks pretty good looks grilled
so here we go
taste test very good are you still
pretty crisp
although definitely not as crisp is a
traditional pickle because that grilling
did soften it up very slightly but I
really like the flavor
you do get a subtle smoke pepper is also
very good kind of sweet and sour and
that's it pickled grilled pickles very
cool idea this is going to make a great
garnish to all our grilled summer meats
and again this is just a very
straightforward basic first attempt
there's a million ways we could trick
out that brining liquid and I'm sure as

so I hope you do anyway go to the site
all the ingredients are there
first and as always enjoy
